title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement andrew.bruce@northstarrevenueintegrity.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Fee Schedule Calculations
text: Physician Fee Schedule Variables  Physician Fee Schedule Formulas  corresponding GPCI value three components RVU, formula essentially dot product RVU GPCI vectors, multiplied Conversion Factor:  \[ RVU \cdot GPCI = RVU_w(GPCI_w) + RVU_p(GPCI_p) + RVU_m(GPCI_m) \]   Using base r’s matrix multiplication infix operator  Using dot() function {pracma} package
code: wrvu  = 6.26   # Work RVU wgpci = 1      # Work GPCI  pgpci = 0.883  # Practice GPCI prvu  = 4.36   # Practice RVU  mrvu  = 0.99   # Malpractice RVU mgpci = 1.125  # Malpractice GPCI  cf    = 32.744 # Conversion Factor  rvus <- (wrvu * wgpci) + (prvu * pgpci) + (mrvu * mgpci) rvus # Total RVUs #> [1] 11.22363 rvus * cf # Participating Fee #> [1] 367.5065 as.vector(c(wrvu, prvu, mrvu) %*% c(wgpci, pgpci, mgpci)) #> [1] 11.22363 pracma::dot(   c(wrvu, prvu, mrvu),    c(wgpci, pgpci, mgpci)) #> [1] 11.22363 calculate_amounts(   wrvu  = 6.26,   nprvu = 7.92,   fprvu = 4.36,   mrvu  = 0.99,   cf    = 32.744,   wgpci = 1,   pgpci = 0.883,   mgpci = 1.125) |>    tt() |>    format_tt(markdown = TRUE) |>    style_tt(bootstrap_class = "table table-hover")

title: Adjustment Codes — adjustment_codes
text: Claim Adjustment Reason Codes: X12 External Code Source 139 codes describe claim service line paid differently billed generally assign responsibility adjustment amounts. Claim Adjustment Group Codes internal X12 standard. format always two alpha characters: CO: Contractual Obligations CR: Corrections Reversals OA: Adjustments PI: Payer Initiated Reductions PR: Patient Responsibility Remittance Advice Remark Codes: X12 External Code Source 411 Remittance Advice Remark Codes (RARCs) used provide additional explanation adjustment already described Claim Adjustment Reason Code (CARC) convey information remittance processing. two types RARCs: Supplemental Informational: majority RARCs supplemental , , generally referred RARCs without distinction. Supplemental RARCs provide additional explanation adjustment already described CARC. second type informational; prefaced Alert: referred Alerts. used convey information remittance processing never related specific adjustment CARC.

title: Restructured BETOS Classification for HCPCS — rbcs
text: Restructured BETOS Classification System (RBCS) taxonomy allows researchers group Medicare Part B healthcare service codes clinically meaningful categories subcategories. Based original Berenson-Eggers Type Service (BETOS) classification created 1980s, includes notable updates Part B non-physician services undergoes annual updates technical expert panel researchers clinicians. general framework grouping service codes new RBCS taxonomy largely follows structure BETOS. Like BETOS, RBCS groups HCPCS codes categories, subcategories, families – categories aggregate level families granular level. Medicare Part B service codes, including non-physician services, assigned 6-character RBCS taxonomy code.

title: NUCC Provider Taxonomy Code Set — taxonomy
text: display name combination code name Level code nested, precisely identifies code. example, Addiction Medicine physician subspecialty Anesthesiology, Family Medicine, Internal Medicine, Preventive Medicine, Psychiatry & Neurology. "Addiction Medicine" identify specialty physician, display name "Addiction Medicine (Internal Medicine) Physician" clearly . another example, "Radiology" confused several taxonomies, "Radiology Chiropractor" accurately specifies provider.
